strutR 0.1.0
  • Reference
    • Struthers Wetting-Front Model for Infiltration, Redistribution, and Drainage with ET (θ★ / θwp)

Infiltration-redistribution-drainage step (Struthers-style fronts)

Source: R/strut.R
struthers_redistr_under.Rd

Advances the Struthers front-based soil column by one sub-step under a given top flux \(f_t\), performing (i) possible creation of a new top front, (ii) pre-merge of adjacent fronts, (iii) simultaneous update of \(\theta\) at all fronts via a Picard solve, (iv) update of the front depths \(x\) by exact storage balance, (v) post-merge, and (vi) deep drainage on the shallowest (topmost) front with clamping \(x\le L\).

Usage

struthers_redistr_under(
  fronts,
  theta_r,
  theta_s,
  beta,
  Ks,
  L = 2,
  delta = 0,
  f_t,
  dt_sub = 1,
  infill_all = FALSE,
  debug = FALSE,
  theta_field_capacity = NA_real_,
  Z_1 = NA_real_,
  tol_merge = 1e-06,
  solver_max_iter = 20,
  solver_tol_theta = 1e-08,
  solver_max_halvings = 2
)

Arguments

fronts

list of fronts, each list(theta=..., x=...) (at least one).

theta_r, theta_s

residual and saturation water contents (-).

beta

Brooks-Corey shape parameter used in \(K(\theta)\).

Ks

saturated hydraulic conductivity m/day.

L

total soil depth m.

delta

geometric offset above the first stored layer m.

f_t

imposed top flux m/day for this sub-step.

dt_sub

sub-step duration day.

infill_all

logical; if TRUE all \(f_t\) is injected at the shallowest layer in one fixed update (debug/compatibility mode).

debug

logical; if TRUE prints detailed diagnostics.

theta_field_capacity, Z_1

kept for backward compatibility (unused here).

tol_merge

merging tolerance for fronts.

solver_max_iter, solver_tol_theta, solver_max_halvings

Picard controls and time-halving retry budget used when infill_all=FALSE.

Value

A list with

  • fronts: updated fronts after post-merge;

  • fronts_infil: snapshot of fronts immediately after the "geometric" infiltration and pre-merge (useful for plotting);

  • drainage: deep drainage volume m released in this sub-step.

Details

Step order (faithful to the i-r-d sequence in the original formulation)

  1. Optional new top front: if \(f_t > K(\theta_\mathrm{top})\), create a thin head-front at \(x\approx \delta\) with \(\theta_\mathrm{new} = \theta_r + (\theta_s-\theta_r)(f_t/K_s)^\beta\).

  2. Pre-merge: merge negligible layers (tolerance tol_merge).

  3. Simultaneous \(\theta\) solve: use Picard iteration (.solve_q_step_picard) unless infill_all=TRUE, in which case all the boundary flux is imposed at the topmost layer for one fixed update.

  4. Update front depths: from exact mass balance (Eq. 1 in code comments), using previous and updated \(\theta\).

  5. Apply state and post-merge: write back \(\theta,x\) and merge again.

  6. Deep drainage: only on the shallowest stored layer; excess thickness \(x_1-L\) is converted into drainage volume proportional to the local contrast in \(\theta\) and \(x_1\) is clamped to \(L\).

Field capacity corrections are intentionally not applied here to keep the sequencing faithful to i-r-d; if desired, they should be applied after redistribution/merge and before ET at the caller level.

References

Struthers-style front models for infiltration-redistribution-drainage; Brooks, R.H. & Corey, A.T. (1966) Hydraulic properties of porous media.

See also

.solve_q_step_picard

Examples

## Minimal call (using predefined Kfun, merging, f_euler utilities):
# out <- struthers_redistr_under(fronts, theta_r=0.05, theta_s=0.45, beta=1/8,
#                                Ks=1.0, L=2.0, delta=0.2, f_t=0.01, dt_sub=1/24)
